case_title: Members Raja NAVED AHMED vs MEMBER-I, BOARD OF REVENUE, BALUCHISTAN and 2 others

rules_involved: West Pakistan Tehsildari and Naib-Tehsildari Service Rules, 1962
West Pakistan Tehsildari and Naib-Tehsildari Departmental Examination and Training Rules, 1969

arguments.appellants: Claimed eligibility for confirmation under rule 10(3) of 1962 Rules and opposed requirement for departmental examination.
arguments.respondents: Directed appellants to appear in departmental examination for confirmation.

key_points.government_action: Amendment in section 7 of Baluchistan Civil Servants Act, 1974 via Ordinance-III of 1983.
court_findings: Legislation can be retrospective if clearly expressed.
Confirmation requires passing departmental examination as per rules.
Deeming clause does not imply automatic confirmation.
key_points.final_decision: Appeals dismissed due to lack of merit and absence of final order.

civil_servants_act.section_7_amendment: Removed automatic confirmation after two years.
